thread.title: April-Dec buffalo meat exports rise 7 percent: government body

title: April-Dec buffalo meat exports rise 7 percent: government body

organizations.name: processed food products export development authority

text:
23 PM / in an hour April-Dec buffalo meat exports rise 7 percent: government body Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
MUMBAI (Reuters) - India‘s buffalo meat exports during April-December rose 7 percent from a year earlier to 1.07 tonnes due to good demand from Vietnam and Malaysia, a government body said on Wednesday. 
The South Asian country’s non basmati rice exports during the period jumped 39.5 percent from a year ago to 6.34 million tonnes as Bangladesh and Benin raised purchases, the Agricultural and Processed Food Products Export Development Authority said in a statement. 
India is the world’s biggest exporter of buffalo meat and rice. Reporting by Rajendra Jadhav; Editing by Vyas Mohan
